title: Sean Longstaff told to ignore dream Manchester United transfer
text:
Longstaff was linked with a move to Manchester (Picture: Getty Images)

Sean Longstaff has been told to forget about a £50million transfer to Manchester United and focus on his football by his Newcastle United manager Steve Bruce.

The midfielder was heavily linked with a summer switch to Old Trafford but a deal failed to materialise, in part due to Newcastle’s excessive demands for a player who had barely featured in the Premier League.

Longstaff has admitted he was distracted by the prospect of a dream move to one of football’s giants but has failed to replicate the form that saw him shortlisted by United chiefs this season.

Bruce warned Longstaff to focus on his football (Picture: AFP/Getty Images)

And Bruce – a former Manchester United centre-back – believes he should put all talk of a move on ice.

‘I think Sean Longstaff now needs to concentrate on his own performances, rather than worrying about speculation and tittle-tattle,’ said Bruce.

‘I don’t think there was any real legs in the Man United story, it all happened before I arrived here.

‘All Sean can do now is recover from his bad knee and start putting in the performances that would ultimately get you linked – and start playing well again.

‘You are a young lad, you are going to be (distracted). He’s got to learn to put that aside and just get on with the job in hand, which is playing for us.’

Longstaff feels he deserves a new contract after making his first-team breakthrough with the Magpies but Bruce Warner him to focus on all the external noise and let his football do the talking on the pitch.

‘I do believe he signed a new contract last Christmas. There is no problem there contract wise,’ Bruce added.

‘The thing for him now is to forget contracts, forget his knee injury, forget Man Utd, it’s all about playing well for us now and getting back to playing like we know he is capable.’
